info.title: ietf-ipv6-unicast-routing
info.description:
This YANG module augments the 'ietf-routing' module with basic
        configuration and state data for IPv6 unicast routing.

        Copyright (c) 2014 IETF Trust and the persons identified as
        authors of the code. All rights reserved.

        Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or
        without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject to
        the license terms contained in, the Simplified BSD License set
        forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions
        Relating to IETF Documents
        (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).

        The key words 'MUST', 'MUST NOT', 'REQUIRED', 'SHALL', 'SHALL
        NOT', 'SHOULD', 'SHOULD NOT', 'RECOMMENDED', 'MAY', and
        'OPTIONAL' in the module text are to be interpreted as described
        in RFC 2119 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2119).

        This version of this YANG module is part of RFC XXXX
        (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfcXXXX); see the RFC itself for
        full legal notices.

**IETF Standard YANG Model**
**Module:** `ietf-ipv6-unicast-routing`
**Paths:** 24

send-advertisements.description:
A flag indicating whether or not the router sends periodic
              Router Advertisements and responds to Router
              Solicitations.

max-rtr-adv-interval.description:
The maximum time allowed between sending unsolicited
              multicast Router Advertisements from the interface.

min-rtr-adv-interval.description:
The value MUST NOT be greater than 75 % of
                'max-rtr-adv-interval'.

managed-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the 'Managed address
              configuration' flag field in the Router Advertisement.

other-config-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the 'Other configuration' flag
              field in the Router Advertisement.

link-mtu.description:
The value to be placed in MTU options sent by the router.
              A value of zero indicates that no MTU options are sent.

reachable-time.description:
The value to be placed in the Reachable Time field in the
              Router Advertisement messages sent by the router. A value
              of zero means unspecified (by this router).

retrans-timer.description:
The value to be placed in the Retrans Timer field in the
              Router Advertisement messages sent by the router. A value
              of zero means unspecified (by this router).

cur-hop-limit.description:
The value to be placed in the Cur Hop Limit field in the
              Router Advertisement messages sent by the router. A value
              of zero means unspecified (by this router).

              If this parameter is not configured, the device SHOULD use
              the value specified in IANA Assigned Numbers that was in
              effect at the time of implementation.

default-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Router Lifetime field of
              Router Advertisements sent from the interface, in seconds.
              It MUST be either zero or between max-rtr-adv-interval and
              9000 seconds. A value of zero indicates that the router is
              not to be used as a default router. These limits may be
              overridden by specific documents that describe how IPv6
              operates over different link layers.

              If this parameter is not configured, the device SHOULD use
              a value of 3 * max-rtr-adv-interval.

no-advertise.description:
The prefix will not be advertised.

                    This can be used for removing the prefix from the
                    default set of advertised prefixes.

valid-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime in
                      the Prefix Information option. The designated
                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

on-link-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the on-link flag
                      ('L-bit') field in the Prefix Information
                      option.

preferred-lifetime.description:
This value MUST NOT be greater than
                        valid-lifetime.

autonomous-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

no-advertise.description:
The prefix will not be advertised.

                    This can be used for removing the prefix from the
                    default set of advertised prefixes.

valid-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime in
                      the Prefix Information option. The designated
                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

on-link-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the on-link flag
                      ('L-bit') field in the Prefix Information
                      option.

preferred-lifetime.description:
This value MUST NOT be greater than
                        valid-lifetime.

autonomous-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

prefix-list.description:
Configuration of prefixes to be placed in Prefix
              Information options in Router Advertisement messages sent
              from the interface.

              Prefixes that are advertised by default but do not have
              their entries in the child 'prefix' list are advertised
              with the default values of all parameters.

              The link-local prefix SHOULD NOT be included in the list
              of advertised prefixes.

put.description: Create or replace Configuration of IPv6 Router Advertisements.

A flag indicating whether or not the router sends periodic
              Router Advertisements and responds to Router
              Solicitations.

max-rtr-adv-interval.description:
The maximum time allowed between sending unsolicited
              multicast Router Advertisements from the interface.

min-rtr-adv-interval.description:
The value MUST NOT be greater than 75 % of
                'max-rtr-adv-interval'.

managed-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the 'Managed address
              configuration' flag field in the Router Advertisement.

other-config-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the 'Other configuration' flag
              field in the Router Advertisement.

link-mtu.description:
The value to be placed in MTU options sent by the router.
              A value of zero indicates that no MTU options are sent.

reachable-time.description:
The value to be placed in the Reachable Time field in the
              Router Advertisement messages sent by the router. A value
              of zero means unspecified (by this router).

retrans-timer.description:
The value to be placed in the Retrans Timer field in the
              Router Advertisement messages sent by the router. A value
              of zero means unspecified (by this router).

cur-hop-limit.description:
The value to be placed in the Cur Hop Limit field in the
              Router Advertisement messages sent by the router. A value
              of zero means unspecified (by this router).

              If this parameter is not configured, the device SHOULD use
              the value specified in IANA Assigned Numbers that was in
              effect at the time of implementation.

default-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Router Lifetime field of
              Router Advertisements sent from the interface, in seconds.
              It MUST be either zero or between max-rtr-adv-interval and
              9000 seconds. A value of zero indicates that the router is
              not to be used as a default router. These limits may be
              overridden by specific documents that describe how IPv6
              operates over different link layers.

              If this parameter is not configured, the device SHOULD use
              a value of 3 * max-rtr-adv-interval.

no-advertise.description:
The prefix will not be advertised.

                    This can be used for removing the prefix from the
                    default set of advertised prefixes.

valid-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime in
                      the Prefix Information option. The designated
                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

on-link-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the on-link flag
                      ('L-bit') field in the Prefix Information
                      option.

preferred-lifetime.description:
This value MUST NOT be greater than
                        valid-lifetime.

autonomous-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

no-advertise.description:
The prefix will not be advertised.

                    This can be used for removing the prefix from the
                    default set of advertised prefixes.

valid-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime in
                      the Prefix Information option. The designated
                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

on-link-flag.description:

                      ('L-bit') field in the Prefix Information
                      option.

preferred-lifetime.description:
This value MUST NOT be greater than
                        valid-lifetime.

autonomous-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

prefix-list.description:
Configuration of prefixes to be placed in Prefix
              Information options in Router Advertisement messages sent
              from the interface.

              Prefixes that are advertised by default but do not have
              their entries in the child 'prefix' list are advertised
              with the default values of all parameters.

              The link-local prefix SHOULD NOT be included in the list
              of advertised prefixes.

no-advertise.description:
The prefix will not be advertised.

                    This can be used for removing the prefix from the
                    default set of advertised prefixes.

valid-lifetime.description:
The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime in
                      the Prefix Information option. The designated
                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

on-link-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the on-link flag
                      ('L-bit') field in the Prefix Information
                      option.

preferred-lifetime.description:
This value MUST NOT be greater than
                        valid-lifetime.

autonomous-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

                    default set of advertised prefixes.

                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

on-link-flag.description:

                      ('L-bit') field in the Prefix Information
                      option.

preferred-lifetime.description:

                        valid-lifetime.

autonomous-flag.description:
The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

The prefix will not be advertised.

                    This can be used for removing the prefix from the
                    default set of advertised prefixes.

The value to be placed in the Valid Lifetime in
                      the Prefix Information option. The designated
                      value of all 1's (0xffffffff) represents
                      infinity.

                      option.

                        valid-lifetime.

The value to be placed in the Autonomous Flag
                      field in the Prefix Information option.

tags.name: ietf-ipv6-unicast-routing
tags.description:
This YANG module augments the 'ietf-routing' module with basic
        configuration and state data for IPv6 unicast routing.
